labels.analysis: The Mapbox MCP Server provides tools for integrating Mapbox's geospatial and navigation capabilities into applications. Its core functionality revolves around mapping, geocoding, and calculating travel times and distances between locations. The available tools enable users to access directions, travel matrices, and geocoding services, making it ideal for applications requiring real-time mapping and location-based services.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Travel & Maps" was chosen because the server's primary functionality is centered around mapping, navigation, and geospatial data. Additional labels "Web Search & Research" and "Data Analysis & Processing" were selected because the server facilitates searching for places (geocoding) and analyzing travel distances/times (matrix calculations), which are relevant to research and data analysis tasks. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.overview: Integrate Mapbox's powerful navigation and search capabilities into your applications. Access directions, travel matrices, and geocoding services seamlessly. Enhance your projects with real-time mapping functionalities using this server.

tools.name: mapbox_directions

tools.name: mapbox_directions_by_places
tools.description: Get navigation route between multiple places using their names

tools.name: mapbox_matrix
tools.description: Calculate travel time and distance matrices between coordinates

tools.name: mapbox_matrix_by_places
tools.description: Calculate travel time and distance matrices between places using their names

tools.name: mapbox_geocoding
tools.description: Search for places and convert addresses into coordinates

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@ngoiyaeric/mapbox-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
